results.title: One day in perfect health
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions and John Krish
results.brief_description: The story of the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, showing the work being done in combating tropical diseases. The film refers to the School’s early history and some of the famous scientists associated with it. To this school, and its hospital, come doctors and students from many countries to learn and study at first hand diseases such as malaria, sleeping sickness, and leprosy. The film was made for the British Central Office of Information.

results.title: One day's poison
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Donald Wilder
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the poison control centre at the Toronto Sick Children’s Hospital, using dramatised incidents to illustrate the variety and number of accidental poisoning’s among children. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: One brick wall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
Construction of one brick return angle. Use of two lines in walls more than one brick in thickness. Treatment at corners, toothing, racking back. Datum pegs and gauge rod. Laying of damp-proof courses, slates and bituminous felt. String and zinc tingles. Blacking out lines for piers. Protection of air brick by slate or Welsh arch. Construction of Welsh arch.

results.title: One born every day
results.brief_description: Demonstrates to the city dweller in particular, the havoc caused by careless disposal of lighted matches, cigarette butts and unthoughtful lighting of fires in the open air in summer.

results.title: One billion trees: towards the greening of Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the subject of tree conservation in Australia. In the past with European settlement, trees were demolished at a rapid rate to make room for livestock and agriculture, our early settlers were unaware that only 15% of Australia was covered by trees. With our policy of deliberate tree felling that percentage has dropped to 5, and the delicate balance of the ecosystems have been distrubed leading to soil erosion and a loss of agricultural productivity. A national tree program titled “Greening Australia” is going on in many parts of the country promoting public awareness and community action. Greening Australia is helping the community grow 1 billion tree by the year 2000. No other credits available.

results.title: One armed bandit
results.brief_description: Three animated sketches show the dark side of greed. In each sketch a poker machine swallows up those bitten by the gambling bug. No spoken language - sound effects only.

results.title: One another
results.brief_description:
Two protagonists search for themselves/each other within morphing boundaries and shifting skies.
Charcoal drawing on erasure stop frame animation with live action video.
Music composed by Joseph Tawadros and performed by Joseph Tawadros, James Tawadros and Ben Rodgers.

results.title: One and one makes three
results.creator_credit: Telefeatures, Stella Productions, Nicholas Cockram and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: The first in a series of films about parenthood, this film aims to give prospective parents a realistic picture of the problems and joys that come with the new addition to the family: the first child. Many young people slip into parenthood without really knowing what to expect. This film could be appropriately subtitled: ‘What nobody ever told you about having babies’. Presented by Jacki Weaver.

results.title: One and a half dreams
results.creator_credit: Walter Rothschild Enterprises and George W. Frayne
results.brief_description: Introduces the work of the UN Development Program, initially contrasting the childhoods of a US astronaut and a boy in a developing country. Shows something of this program’s involvement in a number of countries and specificlaly looks at an agricultural training program in one developing country. Representatives of this project describe its organisation, function and prospects.
